twcore.core.command
Class CommandInterpreter

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.command.CommandInterpreter

public class CommandInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object

A simple alternative to manually handling commands. Command triggers (such as !help) are registered with the bot, along with message types that are accepted, and the method that should be called when the command is triggered Optionally you can also include a minimum access level required to use the command, and/or a help message used to generate automated help displays based on the access level of the person requesting help.

To use the CommandInterpreter: instantiate a CommandInterpreter in your class; register the commands using the registerCommand method; send all Message events received by your bot to the CommandInterpreter for handling.

Some examples of how to use various methods:

 registerCommand( "!help", Message.PRIVATE_MESSAGE, this, cmdHelp );
 registerCommand( "!die", Message.PUBLIC_MESSAGE, this, cmdDie, "!die - Kills bot" );
 registerCommand( "8th", Message.CHAT_MESSAGE, this, cmdSell, "8th - sell", OperatorList.HIGHMOD_LEVEL );

Here is how the CommandInterpreter algorithm goes:

1. A Message event is fired within a class that is running this CommandInterpreter.
2. If the Message matches a trigger of a registered command, continue.
3. If the Message type is one of the accepted types of the matched command, continue.
4. If the sender is at least of the access level required for the command, continue.
5. Execute the method specified of the class specified in the matched command.

For more advanced command handling, see the /misc/Command/AdvancedCommandHandler class.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Jeremy

Method Detail

registerCommand

public void registerCommand(java.lang.String trigger,
                            int messageTypes,
                            java.lang.Object methodClass,
                            java.lang.String methodName)
Registers a command with a provided trigger, message type, class, and method name. The trigger is automatically defined as the default help message, and the required access level will be set by default to 0 (no special access required).

Parameters:
trigger - The text trigger of the command, such as "!help" or "!go"
messageTypes - Message types accepted as defined in Message; use | (bit OR) to combine multiple types
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)
methodName - Method of methodClass to be called if the command's trigger and type match

registerCommand

public void registerCommand(java.lang.String trigger,
                            int messageTypes,
                            java.lang.Object methodClass,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.String helpMessage)
Registers a command with a provided trigger, message type, class, method name, and help message. Required access level will default to 0 (no special access required).

Parameters:
trigger - The text trigger of the command, such as "!help" or "!go"
messageTypes - Message types accepted as defined in Message; use | (bit OR) to combine multiple types
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)
methodName - Method of methodClass to be called if the command's trigger and type match
helpMessage - Help message used in getCommandHelps() and getCommandHelpsForAccessLevel()

registerCommand

public void registerCommand(java.lang.String trigger,
                            int messageTypes,
                            java.lang.Object methodClass,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            int opLevelReq)
Registers a command with a provided trigger, message type, class, method name, and minimum necessary access level to execute. The trigger is automatically defined as the default help message.

Parameters:
trigger - The text trigger of the command, such as "!help" or "!go"
messageTypes - Message types accepted as defined in Message; use | (bit OR) to combine multiple types
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)
methodName - Method of methodClass to be called if the command's trigger and type match
opLevelReq - Minimum access level needed to access this command as defined in OperatorList

registerCommand

public void registerCommand(java.lang.String trigger,
                            int messageTypes,
                            java.lang.Object methodClass,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.String helpMessage,
                            int opLevelReq)
Registers a command with a provided trigger, message type, class, method name, help message, and minimum necessary access level to execute.

Parameters:
trigger - The text trigger of the command, such as "!help" or "!go"
messageTypes - Message types accepted as defined in Message; use | (bit OR) to combine multiple types
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)
methodName - Method of methodClass to be called if the command's trigger and type match
helpMessage - Help message used in getCommandHelps() and getCommandHelpsForAccessLevel()
opLevelReq - Minimum access level needed to access this command as defined in OperatorList

registerDefaultCommand

public void registerDefaultCommand(int messageType,
                                   java.lang.Object methodClass,
                                   java.lang.String methodName)
Registers a default command. A default command is the command that executes when no other command is found for the specified message type.

Parameters:
messageType - Message type accepted as defined in Message (use only one)
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)
methodName - Method of methodClass to be called when no trigger that accepts the message type matches

registerHelpCommand

public void registerHelpCommand(int messageTypes,
                                java.lang.Object methodClass)
Registers an automated !help command that PMs a help display to a player based on access level. If you do not define access levels for commands, all commands will be displayed.

Parameters:
messageTypes - Message types accepted as defined in Message; use | (bit OR) to combine multiple types
methodClass - Class to register the command with (use this)

getCommandHelps

public java.util.Collection getCommandHelps()
Returns all registered help messages, regardless of access level. Use if you are not specifying minimum access levels for your commands.

Returns:
Vector as a collection containing the strings of all help messages

getCommandHelpsForAccessLevel

public java.util.Collection getCommandHelpsForAccessLevel(int accessLevel)
Returns all help messages for commands available to a given access level.

Returns:
Vector as a collection containing the strings of all help msgs for a given access level

getCommandHelp

public java.lang.String getCommandHelp(java.lang.String trigger)
Gets a particular help message for a particular command, as specified by its trigger.

Parameters:
trigger - The text trigger of the command, such as "!help" or "!go"
Returns:
The string of the help message registered with the command

handleEvent

public boolean handleEvent(Message event)
Handles the Message event for a bot to interpret any incoming commands. In order for CommandInterpreter to work properly, this method must be called every time the bot received a Message event. The method checks the message text against its list of triggers, and if message types & required access levels match, executes the command's registered method.

Parameters:
event - Message event
Returns:
true if it succeeded and false if it didn't
